questions.question_text: Which two practices should be used for processing records in a trigger? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Use a Set to ensure unique values in a query filter.
choices.A: Use a Map to reduce the number of SOQL calls.
choices.D: Use (callout=true) to update an external system.
choices.B: Use @future methods to handle DML operations.

questions.question_text: Where can a developer identify the time taken by each process in a transaction using Developer Console log inspector?

choices.B: Execution Tree tab under Stack Tree panel
choices.A: Performance Tree tab under Stack Tree panel
choices.D: Save Order tab under Execution Overview panel
choices.C: Timeline tab under Execution Overview panel

choices.D: Account a = [SELECT Id, Name FROM Account WHERE Id = :con.AccountId LIMIT 1];

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
better explain why not D is a right answer, can it the governor limits https://trailhead.salesforce.com/trailblazer-community/feed/0D54S00000A8GHjSAN
do not ever use dml statements or querying records inside loops.so b and c are correct

comments.content: "D is correct even though the SOQL query in a loop is not the best practice but it can be complied properly": it would be the same also for A then...
Regardless of limit, the loop exceeds governor limits if it executes a large number of times. BC is the right answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
B is not correct, normally there will be a compile error ERROR: Cannot modify a collection while it is being iterated. (FOR i loop could compile but out of index error eventually)
D is correct even though the SOQL query in a loop is not the best practice but it can be complied properly

questions.question_text: Which two statements are acceptable for a developer to use inside procedural loops? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: NULL IS CORRECT IN APEX.UNDEFINED IS CORRECT IN JAVASCRIPT BECAUSE OF HOISTING
It's NULL - Ans. B - Testing in dev Console
ah I almost selected undefined because of javascript! watch out!

choices.A: Create a new Visualforce page and Apex Controller for the list view that provides mass edit, update, and delete functionality.
choices.D: Configure the user interface and enable both inline editing and enhanced lists.
choices.C: Download an unmanaged package from the AppExchange that provides customizable mass edit, update, and delete functionality.
choices.B: Download a managed package from the AppExchange that provides customizable Enhanced List Views and buttons.

discussion.content:
AC for sure:
--Unmanaged packages are customizable
--Managed packages are not

Selected Answer: AD
It would be better to use native functionality, rather than using an app

Selected Answer: AD
Unmanaged packages aren't acceptable to publish on AppExchange.
Managed packages aren't customizable.
So the correct answers should be A & D.

A,B are correct. C is incorrect because only managed package can be published on AppExchange https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.packagingGuide.meta/packagingGuide/managed_packaging_intro.htm
managed pck created in developer org not in app exchange

Selected Answer: AC
A and C fo sho
Correct answer should be A and C as B tak about managed package which is not editable in subscriber org

questions.question_text:
A developer needs to provide a way to mass edit, update, and delete records from a list view.
In which two ways can this be accomplished? (Choose two.)
